<title
    level="1"
    right="Feat 8"
    pfs="Standard"
>
[Remove Presence](/Feats.aspx?ID=3675) <actions string="" />
</title>

<traits>
<trait label="Amp" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=425" />
<trait label="Illusion" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=92" />
<trait label="Mental" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=106" />
<trait label="Occult" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=120" />
<trait label="Psychic" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=430" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

**Source** [Dark Archive](/Sources.aspx?ID=129) pg. 27

</column>

---

Your spell reaches into the mind of a creature and removes you from it. The amped cantrip must be one that has one or more targets and must either require a spell attack roll or have a saving throw. Use this amp in place of the psi cantrip's normal amp entry.

---
**Amp** Choose one target of the spell or one creature in its area. If that enemy fails its save or the spell hits it, you become [undetected](/Conditions.aspx?ID=39) by that creature, disappearing from its senses for 1 minute or until you use a [hostile action](/Rules.aspx?ID=300). This is similar to being [invisible](/Conditions.aspx?ID=26), but effects like [_see invisibility_](/Spells.aspx?ID=271) don't reveal you—you're affecting the target's mind, not its vision. [_True seeing_](/Spells.aspx?ID=344) can still see through this illusion if the [counteract](/Rules.aspx?ID=371) check succeeds.
name: Remove Presence
